title: 111_hr5698
content: PROTECTION OF EMPLOYEES FROM RETALIATION BY THEIR EMPLOYER FOR COOPERATING IN INVESTIGATIONS. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 is amended to include a new section prohibiting retaliation. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 is amended to include a new section prohibiting retaliation against employees for various actions such as reporting violations, refusing to participate in noncompliance, providing information to Congress or relevant proceedings. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 is amended to prohibit retaliation against employees for actions such as providing information to Congress or relevant proceedings. Employees covered by this section can bring an enforcement action for discrimination by an employer, following the rules and procedures of title 49, United States Code. District court review can be sought within 90 days of receiving a final determination by the Secretary of Labor. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 is amended to prohibit retaliation against employees for actions such as providing information to Congress or relevant proceedings. A party may seek district court review within 90 days of receiving a final determination by the Secretary of Labor. The Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to include a new section prohibiting retaliation. The Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to prohibit retaliation against employees for various actions related to reporting violations or noncompliance with the Act. Employees covered by this section are protected from retaliation for providing information to Congress or relevant proceedings, commencing or testifying in proceedings under the Act, or assisting in carrying out the Act's purposes. If discrimination is alleged, the employee can bring an enforcement action following specific legal procedures and remedies outlined in the Act. District court review can be sought within 90 days of receiving a final determination by the Secretary of Labor.
